_header: Mine own dear lady fair and free / I pray you in heart…
_description: A Lover’s Plea — three quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Thei Y singe & murthes make / It is not Y wolde’

CamGon383.First Lines:
Myn owne dere ladi fair & f[re]y pray ow in herte ȝe ruwen
                    on me…
CamGon383.Last Lines: …noun so wel may do myn nedea womman so me tolde
CamGon383.Note:
3 x 4, aaab, plus burden, cb: ‘Þei y synge & murþ I
                    make / it is not y wolde’. Musical notation.
CamGon383.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 300; 1977, 269.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 13-14.
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             Medieval English Love-Lyrics.
         Tübingen: Niemeyer, 1970: 85.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 38-9.
